verses.verse: Now these are the last<WH314> words<WH1697> of David<WH1732>. David<WH1732> the son<WH1121> of Jesse<WH3448> said<WH5002>, and the man<WH1397> who was raised up<WH6965> on high<WH5920>, the anointed<WH4899> of the God<WH430> of Jacob<WH3290>, and the sweet<WH5273> psalmist<WH2158> of Israel<WH3478>, said<WH5002>,
The Spirit<WH7307> of the Lord<WH3068> spoke<WH1696> by me<WH4405>, and his word was in my tongue<WH3956>.

The God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478> said<WH559>, the Rock<WH6697> of Israel<WH3478> spoke<WH1696> to me<WH4910>, He that rules over men<WH120> must be just<WH6662>, ruling<WH4910> in the fear<WH3374> of God<WH430>.

And he shall be as the light<WH216> of the morning<WH1242>, when the sun<WH8121> rises<WH2224>, even a morning<WH1242> without<WH3808> clouds<WH5645>; as the tender grass<WH1877> springing out of the earth<WH776> by clear shining<WH5051> after rain<WH4306>.

Although my house<WH1004> be not so with God<WH410>; yet he has made<WH7760> with me an everlasting<WH5769> covenant<WH1285>, ordered<WH6186> in all things<WH8104>, and sure: for this is all my salvation<WH3468>, and all my desire<WH2656>, although he make it not to grow<WH6779>.
But the sons of Belial<WH1100> shall be all of them as thorns<WH6975> thrust away<WH5074>, because they cannot be taken<WH3947> with hands<WH3027>:

But the man<WH376> that shall touch<WH5060> them must be fenced<WH4390> with iron<WH1270> and the staff<WH6086> of a spear<WH2595>; and they shall be utterly<WH8313> burned<WH8313> with fire<WH784> in the same place<WH7675>.

These be the names<WH8034> of the mighty men<WH1368> whom David<WH1732> had<WH8461>: The Tachmonite that sat<WH3427> in the seat<WH7675>, chief<WH7218> among the captains<WH7991>; the same was Adino<WH5722> the Eznite<WH6112>: he lift up his spear against eight<WH8083> hundred<WH3967>, whom he killed<WH2491> at one<WH259> time<WH6471>.

And after<WH310> him was Eleazar<WH499> the son<WH1121> of Dodo<WH1734> the Ahohite<WH266>, one of the three<WH7969> mighty men<WH1368> with David<WH1732>, when they defied<WH2778> the Philistines<WH6430> that were there gathered together<WH622> to battle<WH4421>, and the men<WH376> of Israel<WH3478> were gone away<WH5927>:

He arose<WH6965>, and struck<WH5221> the Philistines<WH6430> until<WH3588> his hand<WH3027> was weary<WH3021>, and his hand<WH3027> split<WH1692> unto the sword<WH2719>: and the Lord<WH3068> worked<WH6213> a great<WH1419> victory<WH8668> that day<WH3117>; and the people<WH5971> returned<WH7725> after<WH310> him only to plunder<WH6584>.

And after<WH310> him was Shammah<WH8048> the son<WH1121> of Agee<WH89> the Hararite<WH2043>. And the Philistines<WH6430> were gathered together<WH622> into a troop<WH2416>, where was a piece<WH2513> of ground<WH7704> full<WH4392> of lentil<WH5742>: and the people<WH5971> fled<WH5127> from<WH6440> the Philistines<WH6430>.

But he stood<WH3320> in the middle<WH8432> of the ground<WH2513>, and defended<WH5337> it<WH5221>, and killed the Philistines<WH6430>: and the Lord<WH3068> worked<WH6213> a great<WH1419> victory<WH8668>.

And three<WH7969> of the thirty<WH7970> chief<WH7218> went down<WH3381>, and came<WH935> to David<WH1732> in the harvest time<WH7105> unto the cave<WH4631> of Adullam<WH5725>: and the troop<WH2416> of the Philistines<WH6430> pitched<WH2583> in the valley<WH6010> of Rephaim<WH7497>.
And David<WH1732> was then in an hold<WH4686>, and the garrison<WH4673> of the Philistines<WH6430> was then in Beth<WH1035>–lehem.
And David<WH1732> longed<WH183>, and said<WH559>, Oh that one would give me drink<WH8248> of the water<WH4325> of the well<WH953> of Beth<WH1035>–lehem, which is by the gate<WH8179>!

And the three<WH7969> mighty men<WH1368> broke through<WH1234> the army<WH4264> of the Philistines<WH6430>, and drew<WH7579> water<WH4325> out of the well<WH953> of Beth<WH1035>–lehem, that was by the gate<WH8179>, and took<WH5375> it<WH935>, and brought it to David<WH1732>: nevertheless he would<WH14> not drink<WH8354> there<WH5258>, but poured it out unto the Lord<WH3068>.

And he said<WH559>, Be it far<WH2486> from me<WH3068>, O Lord, that I should do<WH6213> this<WH1818>: is not this the blood of the men<WH582> that went<WH1980> in jeopardy of their lives<WH5315>? therefore he would<WH14> not drink<WH8354> it<WH6213>. These things did these three<WH7969> mighty men<WH1368>.

And Abishai<WH52>, the brother<WH251> of Joab<WH3097>, the son<WH1121> of Zeruiah<WH6870>, was chief<WH7218> among three<WH7992>. And he lifted up<WH5782> his spear<WH2595> against three<WH7969> hundred<WH3967>, and killed<WH2491> them<WH8034>, and had the name among three<WH7969>.
Was he not most honorable<WH3513> of three<WH7969>? therefore he was their captain<WH8269>: but he attained<WH935> not unto the first three<WH7969>.

And Benaiah<WH1141> the son<WH1121> of Jehoiada<WH3077>, the son<WH1121> of a valiant<WH2428> man<WH376>, of Kabzeel<WH6909>, who had done many<WH7227> acts<WH6467>, he killed<WH5221> two<WH8147> lionlike men<WH739> of Moab<WH4124>: he went down<WH3381> also and killed<WH5221> a lion<WH738> in the middle<WH8432> of a pit<WH953> in time<WH3117> of snow<WH7950>:

And he killed<WH2026> an Egyptian<WH4713>, a good<WH4758> man<WH376>: and the Egyptian<WH4713> had a spear<WH2595> in his hand<WH3027>; but he went down<WH3381> to him with a staff<WH7626>, and plucked<WH1497> the spear<WH2595> out of the Egyptian<WH4713>'s hand<WH3027>, and killed<WH5221> him with his own spear<WH2595>.
These things did<WH6213> Benaiah<WH1141> the son<WH1121> of Jehoiada<WH3077>, and had the name<WH8034> among three<WH7969> mighty men<WH1368>.
He was more honorable<WH3513> than the thirty<WH7970>, but he attained<WH935> not to the first three<WH7969>. And David<WH1732> set<WH7760> him over his guard<WH4928>.
Asahel<WH6214> the brother<WH251> of Joab<WH3097> was one of the thirty<WH7970>; Elhanan<WH445> the son<WH1121> of Dodo<WH1734> of Beth<WH1035>–lehem,
Shammah<WH8048> the Harodite<WH2733>, Elika<WH470> the Harodite<WH2733>,
Helez<WH2503> the Paltite<WH6407>, Ira<WH5896> the son<WH1121> of Ikkesh<WH6142> the Tekoite<WH8621>,
Abiezer<WH44> the Anethothite<WH6069>, Mebunnai<WH4012> the Hushathite<WH2843>,
Zalmon<WH6756> the Ahohite<WH266>, Maharai<WH4121> the Netophathite<WH5200>,
Heleb<WH2460> the son<WH1121> of Baanah<WH1196>, a Netophathite<WH5200>, Ittai<WH863> the son<WH1121> of Ribai<WH7380> out of Gibeah<WH1390> of the sons<WH1121> of Benjamin<WH1144>,
Benaiah<WH1141> the Pirathonite<WH6553>, Hiddai<WH1914> of the brooks<WH5158> of Gaash<WH1608>,
Abi<WH45>–albon the Arbathite<WH6164>, Azmaveth<WH5820> the Barhumite<WH1273>,
Eliahba<WH455> the Shaalbonite<WH8170>, of the sons<WH1121> of Jashen<WH3464>, Jonathan<WH3083>,
Shammah<WH8048> the Hararite<WH2043>, Ahiam<WH279> the son<WH1121> of Sharar<WH8325> the Hararite<WH2043>,
Eliphelet<WH467> the son<WH1121> of Ahasbai<WH308>, the son<WH1121> of the Maachathite<WH4602>, Eliam<WH463> the son<WH1121> of Ahithophel<WH302> the Gilonite<WH1526>,
Hezrai<WH2695> the Carmelite<WH3761>, Paarai<WH6474> the Arbite<WH701>,
Igal<WH3008> the son<WH1121> of Nathan<WH5416> of Zobah<WH6678>, Bani<WH1137> the Gadite<WH1425>,
Zelek<WH6768> the Ammonite<WH5984>, Naharai<WH5171> the Beerothite<WH886>, armor bearer<WH5375> to Joab<WH3097> the son<WH1121> of Zeruiah<WH6870>,
Ira<WH5896> an Ithrite<WH3505>, Gareb<WH1619> an Ithrite<WH3505>,
Uriah<WH223> the Hittite<WH2850>: thirty<WH7970> and seven in all<WH7651>.
